body_html:
Are you sure (1) your training hasn't started, and (2) is it not a memory problem in your model?

For (1), check if there's any event/checkpoint files being outputted. For (2), check your input pipeline, etc.

A relevant SO question and answer that explains what the pool allocator messages mean: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/35151207/how-to-interpret-poolallocator-messages-in-tensorflow
body_text:
Are you sure (1) your training hasn't started, and (2) is it not a memory problem in your model?
For (1), check if there's any event/checkpoint files being outputted.  For (2), check your input pipeline, etc.
A relevant SO question and answer that explains what the pool allocator messages mean:  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/35151207/how-to-interpret-poolallocator-messages-in-tensorflow
body:
Are you sure (1) your training hasn't started, and (2) is it not a memory problem in your model?

For (1), check if there's any event/checkpoint files being outputted.  For (2), check your input pipeline, etc.

A relevant SO question and answer that explains what the pool allocator messages mean:  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/35151207/how-to-interpret-poolallocator-messages-in-tensorflow
